questions.question: What are the dimensions of the drag coefficient?
Which of the following statements is true regarding acceleration due to gravity?

answers.a: Acceleration due to gravity at the poles is higher compared to that at the equator
answers.b: Acceleration due to gravity is the same for all heights above the earth
answers.c: Acceleration due to gravity is constant at all places on earth

questions.question: Two balls of mass m and 2m each are dropped from the top of a building with no significant air resistance. If t1 and t2 are the time required for the masses m and 2m to reach the ground respectively, which of the following statements are true ?
Which of the following graphs represents an object having constant velocity?
What is the projected area of the following body as it falls vertically downwards in the fluid?
If a steel sphere of mass 0.02 kg and projected area 2×10⁻⁴ m² is falling in air with drag coefficient 0.47 and air density 1.2 kg/m³, estimate its terminal velocity.
